BTW, I got curious why we now have this requirement. It found that it was introduced two months ago when implementing the multi-attach test cases, but then wasn't treated as the API change for the TestDriver interface but rather got handled only in some of its implementations (those that use `GetStorageClass`):
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/commit/b4c88acec63ebd678d2e5a7a3db1b6da22d39b96
Please document that volume node affinity is optional and may be nil.
Added, and the copyright  year is updated to 2019

My understanding is that `TestConfig` is ultimately used to configure each test, but it's passed to the driver during initialization so the driver has a chance to add more configs, is this correct?

It'd be helpful to define even more precisely how `TestConfig` is used here, to make its misuse by future devs less likely.

Correct. `DriverInfo` is the static part that gets defined by the test driver author once. `TestConfig` is the part which is more dynamic and contains fields that can be different for different tests.

@verult: Does  ae97d59977ba0cdb9a0b71200989d92c0f30d444 sufficiently explain the relationship between test definition, test execution, DriverInfo and TestConfig?

I am aware that `testsuites.RunTestSuites` is named a bit inappropriately, because it doesn't actually run any tests, it merely defines them. But I didn't want to make more changes than strictly necessary, therefore I have kept the name.
Thanks for the doc! Looks great to me. My one nit would be I don't think think it's necessary to describe the ginkgo interactions common across all e2es, but I don't mind either way.
Let's keep it in. I'm going to come back to that in the next PR where I introduce delayed test registration, because then it won't be just the usual "register at init".

The existence of two `TestConfig`s is going to be very confusing. Is it possible to have a clearer divide between the purposes of the two structs?

Some possibilities:
* Improve the comments for `VolumeTestConfig` clearly describing its purpose, and possibly renaming it.
  * Most fields in `VolumeTestConfig` are only used in `volume_util.go`. Could we limit its use only in that file?
* Reduce (or ideally completely eliminate) field overlap between the two structs.

As far as I understand it, `VolumeTestConfig` is from legacy code that @mkimuram continued to use unmodified because some tests and utility code rely on it. I agree that it would be useful to clean that up, but I barely know that code and would prefer to not touch it, or at least not now.

I'll try to enhance the documentation for the new struct, but when it comes to `VolumeTestConfig` I'll basically have to tell developers that they'll have to read the legacy code.
OK, I could create an issue to track the cleanup between the two configs in the future.
